TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit FileWebRequest extends System.Net.WebRequest implements class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable
Public Class FileWebRequest Inherits WebRequest Implements ISerializable
type FileWebRequest = class inherit WebRequest interface ISerializable

Docs.summary: Provides a file system implementation of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest> class implements the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest>`abstract` base class for Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs) that use the `file://` scheme to request local files.
Do not use the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.%23ctor%2A> constructor. Use the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.Create%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to initialize new instances of the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest> class. If the URI scheme is `file://`, the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.Create%2A> method returns a <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest> object.
The <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.GetResponse%2A> method makes a synchronous request for the file specified in the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.RequestUri%2A> property and returns a <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse> object that contains the response. You can make an asynchronous request for the file using the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.BeginGetResponse%2A> and <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.EndGetResponse%2A> methods.
When you want to write data to a file, the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.GetRequestStream%2A> method returns a <xref:System.IO.Stream> instance to write to. The <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.BeginGetRequestStream%2A> and <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.EndGetRequestStream%2A> methods provide asynchronous access to the write data stream.
The <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest> class relies on the <xref:System.IO.File> class for error handling and code access security.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest> class to access a file system resource.
[!code-cpp[System.Net.FileWebRequest#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.FileWebRequest/CPP/getrequeststream.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Net.FileWebRequest#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.FileWebRequest/CS/getrequeststream.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Net.FileWebRequest#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.FileWebRequest/VB/getrequeststream.vb#1)]

.method public hidebysig virtual instance void Abort() cil managed
Public Overrides Sub Abort ()

override this.Abort : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Cancels a request to an Internet resource.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.Abort%2A> method cancels a request to a resource. After a request is canceled, calling the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.GetResponse%2A>, <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.BeginGetResponse%2A>, <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.EndGetResponse%2A>, <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.GetRequestStream%2A>, <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.BeginGetRequestStream%2A>, or <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.EndGetRequestStream%2A> method causes a <xref:System.Net.WebException> with the <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> property set to <xref:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.RequestCanceled>.
**Note** This member outputs trace information when you enable network tracing in your application. For more information, see [Network Tracing in the .NET Framework](~/docs/framework/network-programming/network-tracing.md).

Docs.param: An object that contains state information for this request.
Docs.summary: Begins an asynchronous request for a object to use to write data.
Docs.returns: An that references the asynchronous request.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.BeginGetRequestStream%2A> method starts an asynchronous request for a stream used to send data to a file system resource. The callback method that implements the <xref:System.AsyncCallback> delegate uses the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.EndGetRequestStream%2A> method to return the request stream.
## Examples The following code example uses <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.BeginGetRequestStream%2A> to make an asynchronous request for a <xref:System.IO.Stream> object.
[!code-cpp[FileWebRequest_ReqBeginEnd#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FileWebRequest_ReqBeginEnd/CPP/filewebrequest_reqbeginend.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[FileWebRequest_ReqBeginEnd#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FileWebRequest_ReqBeginEnd/CS/filewebrequest_reqbeginend.cs#2)] [!code-vb[FileWebRequest_ReqBeginEnd#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FileWebRequest_ReqBeginEnd/VB/filewebrequest_reqbeginend.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest> class does not authenticate requests for files from the local file system, it ignores the contents, if any, of the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.Credentials%2A> property. Authentication for <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest> is handled by the access control lists for the file resource in the underlying file system.

Docs.param: An that references the pending request for a stream.
Docs.summary: Ends an asynchronous request for a instance that the application uses to write data.
Docs.returns: A object that the application uses to write data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.EndGetRequestStream%2A> method completes an asynchronous stream request that was started by the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.BeginGetRequestStream%2A> method.
> [!NOTE] > To avoid timing issues with garbage collection, be sure to close the response stream by calling the <xref:System.IO.Stream.Close%2A> method on the stream returned by the <xref:System.Net.FileWebResponse.GetResponseStream%2A> method after calling the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.EndGetResponse%2A> method.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.EndGetRequestStream%2A> method to end the asynchronous request for a <xref:System.IO.Stream> object.
[!code-cpp[FileWebRequest_ReqBeginEnd#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FileWebRequest_ReqBeginEnd/CPP/filewebrequest_reqbeginend.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[FileWebRequest_ReqBeginEnd#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FileWebRequest_ReqBeginEnd/CS/filewebrequest_reqbeginend.cs#2)] [!code-vb[FileWebRequest_ReqBeginEnd#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FileWebRequest_ReqBeginEnd/VB/filewebrequest_reqbeginend.vb#2)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.GetRequestStream%2A> method provides synchronous access to the <xref:System.IO.Stream>. For asynchronous access, use the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.BeginGetRequestStream%2A> and <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.EndGetRequestStream%2A> methods.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.GetRequestStream%2A> method to obtain a stream instance used to write to the file. Refer to the complete example in the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest> class.

Docs.summary: Returns a response to a file system request.
Docs.returns: A that contains the response from the file system resource.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.GetResponse%2A> method returns a <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> object that contains the response from the file system resource.
The <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.GetResponse%2A> method provides synchronous access to the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse>. For asynchronous access, use the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.BeginGetResponse%2A> and <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.EndGetResponse%2A> methods.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.GetResponse%2A> method to return a file system request response.
[!code-cpp[System.Net.FilewebRequest.GetResponse#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.FileWebRequest.GetResponse/CPP/getresponse.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Net.FilewebRequest.GetResponse#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.FileWebRequest.GetResponse/CS/getresponse.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Net.FilewebRequest.GetResponse#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.FileWebRequest.GetResponse/VB/getresponse.vb#1)]

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the length of time until the request times out.
Docs.value: The time, in milliseconds, until the request times out, or the value to indicate that the request does not time out.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A Domain Name System (DNS) query may take up to 15 seconds to return or time out. If your request contains a host name that requires resolution and you set <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.Timeout%2A> to a value less than 15 seconds, it may take 15 seconds or more before a <xref:System.Net.WebException> is thrown to indicate a time-out on your request.
## Examples The following code example sets the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.Timeout%2A> property. Refer to the complete example in the <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest> class.
[!code-cpp[System.Net.FileWebRequest#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.FileWebRequest/CPP/getrequeststream.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.Net.FileWebRequest#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.FileWebRequest/CS/getrequeststream.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Net.FileWebRequest#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Net.FileWebRequest/VB/getrequeststream.vb#3)]

Docs.exception: The value specified is less than or equal to zero and is not .

Docs.summary: Always throws a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.UseDefaultCredentials%2A> property is provided only for compatibility with other implementations of the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> and <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> classes. There is no reason to use <xref:System.Net.FileWebRequest.UseDefaultCredentials%2A>.

Docs.exception: Default credentials are not supported for file Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs).
